etymons.meaning: erlauben, gestatten; < Arab. smḥ (II) cf. Wehr 596: mit Güte handeln

Infectum.text: iḏa kān k-səmḥat, d-obat-li ṭaṣe d-maye m-i=dguštayḏax ʻwenn du erlaubst, gibst du mir eine Schale Wasser aus deinem Krugʼ; 215; 53/64;

k-obaʕno d-aloho msamaḥ-li, w-ono gəd-howéno-le greʕo hul l-u=mawto ʻI want God to forgive me and I will become [His] servant till the very deathʼ; 215; 43/42; uʕdo ʕféli-lux w-k-obaʕno d-msamḥat-li b-i=ġalṭ-aṯi diḏi ‘Now, I have forgiven you and I want you to pardon me for my fault’; 36/138; ono k-msamaḥn-ux, bas gabux lə=k-foyašno ‘I forgive you, but I will not stay with you anymore’; 36/143; gəd-oṯeno uʕdo l-gabux d-msamḥina ḥḏoḏe ‘Now I come to you that we may pardon each other’; 42/10; omər ya malk-ayḏi k-obaʕno mede minux gə-msamḥət-li ebe ‘My king, I want something from you. Will you grant it to me?’ 84/46;
